pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.10_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying and leaning their bodies while walking in inhabited areas. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not sway my body while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.4_0: he should not sway his body while walking in inhabited areas;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.5_0: one should walk keeping one’s body straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.6_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways and leans his body while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
